Class BinomialDistribution

java.lang.Object
BinomialDistribution
public class BinomialDistribution extends Object
The BinomialDistribution class handles the calculation of Binomial Distributions and all other statistical values associated with Binomial Distributions.
Author:
Rachel Hussmann

  • Method Details

    • binomialDistribution

      public double binomialDistribution(int numberOfTrials, double probOfSuccess, int totalNumSuccess)
      The binomialDistribution method calculates the probability of an event based off of a binomial distribution formula.
      Parameters:
      numberOfTrials - The number of trials to be run.
      probOfSuccess - The probability of a successful trial.
      totalNumSuccess - The total number of successes.
      Returns:
      The probability of the event.

    • binomialDistribution

      public BigDecimal binomialDistribution(BigInteger numberOfTrials, BigDecimal probOfSuccess, BigInteger totalNumSuccess)
      The binomialDistribution method calculates the probability of an event based off of a binomial distribution formula.
      Parameters:
      numberOfTrials - The number of trials to be run.
      probOfSuccess - The probability of a successful trial.
      totalNumSuccess - The total number of successes.
      Returns:
      The probability of the event.

    • expectedValue

      public double expectedValue(int numberOfTrials, double probOfSuccess)
      The expectedValue method calculates the mean of a binomial distribution.
      Parameters:
      numberOfTrials - The total number of trials.
      probOfSuccess - The probability of a successful trial.
      Returns:
      The expected value (mean) of the binomial distribution.

    • expectedValue

      public BigDecimal expectedValue(BigInteger numberOfTrials, BigDecimal probOfSuccess)
      The expectedValue method calculates the mean of a binomial distribution.
      Parameters:
      numberOfTrials - The total number of trials.
      probOfSuccess - The probability of a successful trial.
      Returns:
      The expected value (mean) of the binomial distribution.

    • variance

      public double variance(int numberOfTrials, double probOfSuccess)
      The variance method calculates the variance of a binomial distribution.
      Parameters:
      numberOfTrials - The total number of trials.
      probOfSuccess - The probability of success for a trial.
      Returns:
      The variance of the binomial distribution.

    • variance

      public BigDecimal variance(BigInteger numberOfTrials, BigDecimal probOfSuccess)
      The variance method calculates the variance of a binomial distribution.
      Parameters:
      numberOfTrials - The total number of trials.
      probOfSuccess - The probability of success for a trial.
      Returns:
      The variance of the binomial distribution.

    • standardDeviation

      public double standardDeviation(double variance)
      The standardDeviation method calculates the standard deviation of the binomial distribution.
      Parameters:
      variance - The variance of the binomial distribution.
      Returns:
      The standard deviation of the binomial distribution.
